articles.title: Stiff-person syndrome: Celine Dion suffering from rare neurological disease - CTV News Montreal
articles.description: Legendary Canadian singer Celine Dion says she suffering from Moersch-Woltman syndrome, a rare neurological disease causing muscle spasms. As a result, the Quebec-born vocalist announced she will not resume her world tour in Europe next February.
articles.content:

articles.title: Springbok skipper Kolisi named Sharks' European captain ahead of Champions Cup debut - News24
articles.description: The Sharks have named Siya Kolisi as their European campaign captain ahead of their Champions Cup opener against England's Harlequins in Durban, while Lukhanyo Am keeps the armband for the United Rugby Championship.

articles.title: Jawbone found in Spain may mark earliest presence of humans in Europe - Yahoo Singapore News
articles.description: A jawbone which was unearthed in 1887 and previously thought to be Neanderthal may actually mark the earliest evidence for Homo sapiens ever found in Europe.
articles.content:
